Reviews.Title: Great portable powerhouse
Reviews.Author: lemergy
Reviews.Content: This laptop was exactly what I was looking for as sort of a portable desktop.  The 17 inch screen is a great size to watch media with.  The speakers are amazing and it comes with a plug in sub-woofer.  I think they limited the volume max so you don't blow out the speakers so it's not insanely loud but just great rich sound. The laptop description says it weighs 12 plus pounds which is ridiculous so I weighed it on my kitchen scale and it's only 7.8 pounds.  The mouse pad has many functions and can be frustrating at first but once you get used to the swipe motion function it's pretty useful.  2 gigs of dedicated video ram can handle video editing and play most modern games on medium or higher settings.  It has a small onboard video card to save power until the big guy is needed. The 8 gigs of ram can be upgraded to 16 gigs as the two card slots are not hardwired to the motherboard like some other laptops. All in all it's everything I'll need for the next few years.

Reviews.Title: This laptop is a beast!
Reviews.Author: Guillermo Castro
Reviews.Content: Well, first of all I would like to say that English is not my first language, so excuse me if I have some grammatical mistakes. I hope you understand me!The main reason why I bought this PC is for gaming. I just wanted to play every game, at least in low graphics, but I wanted to play them all. I bought it a week ago and I have already tried games such as Farcry 3, Payday 2, Outlast, Minecraft, Skyrim, Black Ops 2.Fow now, I have not any issues. The processor is great, the graphics card as well, and I absolutely love the screen. The only bad thing that I would like to point out is that on the left side of the Laptop, when playing games, it gets hotter than what I expected, but it`s still okay.Something that I would like to recommend is to install the Nvidia graphics card drivers, this problem of the temperature reduces and some games become faster.

Reviews.Title: The latest technology!
Reviews.Author: H. Edwards
Reviews.Content: Took some getting used to but I do love this computer! The size, weight and overall feel is perfect. Pretty easy to learn how to use.

Reviews.Title: ASUS 17.3 inch Laptop
Reviews.Author: Anthony Macias
Reviews.Content: My friend at work recommended ASUS since he loves his ASUS laptop.  He is a gamer so it is great for the graphics.  I wanted a great quality laptop that would provide fast speed and have all the great high tech features.  It is wonderful and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Danica Baker
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a good computer. I'm not the biggest fan of the mouse being flat on the surface of the laptop. (Meaning it doesn't dip in a few mm) However, I would say that about any computer. Great product.

Reviews.Title: fantastic!!!
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe Bonomelli
Reviews.Content: this notebook is fantastic and the price is low related to specifications of this computer...i think this is the best notebook i have ever seen...

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: nitara
Reviews.Content: Its amazing, I truly love it. It's the best computer I have gotten. I think its worth the money. For me who has bad eyes the big screen is great because I can read on it with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Little bit heavy and light leak outs from the keyboard
Reviews.Author: Osman Z.
Reviews.Content: Everyting is OK but the weight was more than I expected.  Sound and picture are all good.But the thin and weak printings on the each key are not very readable and identifiable. The light leaks out from the back lid keyboard, and therefore disturbs eye.Otherwise It is a good laptop.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Machine
Reviews.Author: William B. Moran
Reviews.Content: I wanted a mobile gaming computer and this delivered. It's a little more powerful than my year old desktop and was only slightly more expensive, which is standard comparing desktops and laptops. I had an easy time taking out the standard RAM and upgrading it to 16GB. It's almost as easy as unscrewing the bottom, popping out the two that are in there and popping in the new stuff. You then have to make sure the computer recognizes it, which was the more difficult part.It can get pretty hot so I'd definitely recommend a cooling fan, especially if you use it for long gaming sessions like I do. The new Windows has a bit of a learning curve but it's nothing terrible. It did have a lot of unnecessary apps and I spent the first few hours just removing pesky stuff that I didn't want on my machine. Otherwise I absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: chance
Reviews.Author: Lorraine C. Cadieux
Reviews.Content: To be honest I had reservations in buying a laptop online.  Not being familiar with the name ASUS, I was very hesitant.  So far, this laptop has performed well, I have no complaints.  I did buy the extended warranty, if things keep working the way they do I wont need to have it.  I would buy another ASUS again.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Excellent
Reviews.Author: Sheeple
Reviews.Content: The power of the hardware is amazing. This thing boots so fast. I put the solid state drive from my old laptop into this new beast and it boots so fast it makes my head spin!However...I don't like this keyboard. I just didn't realize, based on the pictures, that it was that type of keyboard you find on Macs. The keys are all spaced out. I hate this. they're small squares and i mistype often. Keys just aren't where i expect them to be.The touchpad is horrible. It's too sensitive. The ASUS driver lets you enable features, but doesn't let you configure the sensitivity. I constantly try two finger scroll and accidentally do the right click menu because they're similar gestures.I can't use the left or right hardware click on the touchpad. On synaptic touchpads, you can configure the area of the touchpad that will respond to touch. if this were available for this touchpad, i would tell it to NEVER REGISTER TOUCH near the part of the touchpad that contains the left and right click.I'm happy with the power, but i regret the keyboard and the mouse on this thing. I wish i hadn't bought this, and that's tough to say because i am a pretty happy guy when it comes to ASUS products.

Reviews.Title: Really Great Computer, Windows 8 is the Wrong OS for It
Reviews.Author: Xochimilco, Esq.
Reviews.Content: I'd really love to give this computer 5 stars. The screen is beautiful, the keyboard spacious, the speakers clear, the processor fast. Fairly light for the size. But it came with Windows 8, which has been a problem. Windows 8 from what I can tell is made primarily for touch screens, especially tablets. This ASUS isn't a touch screen, so you can't use Windows 8 the way it was designed. It all becomes clumsy to use. You're trying to mimic the swipes of a tablet with a touch pad...it just doesn't work smoothly.Perhaps there's a way to put Windows 8 in a mode where it behaves more like Windows 7...If I figure out how to do that, perhaps I'll give this non-touch screen computer 5 stars. It's really great. Except for Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Nolan
Reviews.Content: Surpassed every task and desire I bought it with in mind. Every task I set before this machine is instant in completion. What a wonderful product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome, Huge, Heavy
Reviews.Author: Daryl Lockhart
Reviews.Content: This computer is awesome.  It is like a desktop and can handle any PC game you throw at it with ease.  It does get hot, but its a laptop.  The 17" version is very large, and therefore heavy.  If that's ok, grab this thing.  If not, maybe try the 15".

Reviews.Title: Love it, but...
Reviews.Author: yousef algahtani
Reviews.Content: Exactly what I wanted for speed, and gaming. GREAT PRICE.only negative, if you play demanding games, can feel the heat built up quickly, don't know how much it would take to do damage. Have been conservative with my gaming time.

Reviews.Title: wub
Reviews.Author: simon
Reviews.Content: the laptop is ridiculous. 8 gigs of ram makes the thing run so smooth not to mention the 2 gigs on the nvidia graphics card. game are incredibly smooth and the resolution on the screen is crisp. the mini sub kicks like a champ, it compares to listening to music on a small boom-box. but in general i love it

Reviews.Title: Wow....exceeding expectations!
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I usually wouldn't write a review, but in this case I feel it's a necessity.  I literally can't find anything wrong with this laptop.  It's more powerful than most desktop computers.  It sounds great, performers just as good, and the only let down (I guess) would be that it comes with Windows 8.  I can deal with change, and I've gotten used to Windows 8 now.  I personally know two MacBook owners that are jealous of my new Asus, that should say it all.

Reviews.Title: a perfect laptop!
Reviews.Author: jovi
Reviews.Content: I bought my N76V on first of July, it was amazing! From the price to the service and the quality of laptop was perfect!

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Pat Moss
Reviews.Content: I use this as my portable office when I have to visit customer sites.  The resolution allows me to use visual studio in a productive mode, rather than to just put out fires.  The combo of CPU and RAM actually lets me get things done.My only complaint is the form factor.  It is about 1/8 of an inch wider than 99.9% of all 17" laptops.  I cannot get this thing into my old leather (and very expensive) briefcase.  I had to buy a cheapy one to get around.  Even in the new one, I sheared the end off of my wireless keyboard and mouse dongle.If you don't travel too much, this is an awesome buy.  If you do ... make sure your travel accessories fit, and won't break things in use.Also, it is frickin' heavy, but that comes with the territory.

Reviews.Title: mouse pad difiicult at best
Reviews.Author: Syko
Reviews.Content: Computer runs smoothly came with windows 8 but windows 8 seams to be like vista with many bugs and issues. Put windows 7 on it and it runs fairly smooth not all dirvers were compatible with windows 7 but easier to deal with than windows 8 that has many bugs.The mouse pad is the only problemaic issue with the computer, it is very sensitive and jumps the cursor around while typing. Have to keep hands far away from the pad and off the computer al together while typing. other than that is is a great computer.
